website_summaries.verdict: It’s hard to believe that such a small tool would deliver such high-quality performance, but that’s exactly what buyers get with this product.
pros: Small design with some serious punch, given its high powered nature
Durable enough to withstand daily use while still performing flawlessly
cons: Does not have composite handle, so may cause hand to get cold after extended use

customer_reviews.title: Miss leading discription.
customer_reviews.text: Only issues are with the seller not the product. The grinder works great and I am happy over all. The product description said mad in America so that's why I chose this product. When I received the product I found out it was not. If I had known It was made in Taiwan I would have saved the $30 plus and just purchased one from harbor freight. My last grinder from there lasted 3 years and cost $20ish bucks not on sale.
customer_reviews.author: Smith.travi

customer_reviews.title: Little powerhouse
customer_reviews.text: This little die grinder has some serious cajones - far more that you would expect for the size. When I opened the box I was concerned the small form factor would mean no power, but my use on a brake job removed all concern. Where my IR edge series grinder would bog down, this little CP just powers thru. The small size is great for automotive use. It is a little bit noisier than my IR but still very tolerable. Love this CP - it's my new go-to die grinder!
customer_reviews.author: Vegoose

customer_reviews.title: I like the small size
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one of these. The last one had tens of thousands of hours on it. I Like the small size for getting into tight spots in bowls, and impellers. I work with Dudes' that run with Dotcos, and other $500 plus tools, and I rate these things a lot by the amount of vibration. I expect and require anything I take to the shop to earn its keep, it's going to get used. If your doing hours of handwork with any of these air tools the smoothness of the thing when running determines how much hand fatigue you will get. These by this manufacturer for the money are the smoothest ones I have found.
customer_reviews.author: David Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Works well, nice size with plenty of power
customer_reviews.text: Needed to replace my bargain 1/4 inch air after twenty five years of use. Decided on the CP875 after reading reviews and could not be happier with my purchase. I typically use the die grinder to clean up a gasket surface areas, clean a cast iron pans or surface prep before painting. With my use and a little maintenance occasionally I expect this tool to preform with no issues. I like the size and overall feel of the tool compared to my older tool this tool has much less vibration. Don’t care for the safety device on the handle, takes a little patience in the beginning but becomes second nature pretty quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Glen E ThomasTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Useful.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very useful tool for getting into tight areas. It's pretty low powered and uses different wrenches than its larger cousin but still does the job. As others have noted, it does appear to leak a bit of oil around the air vents which may lead to surface contamination if used for finish work. For me, not a problem as I use a die grinder for roughing, not finish work.
customer_reviews.author: EastMemphis

customer_reviews.title: Good tool
customer_reviews.text: I am an Auto Tech and I was replacing a Matco one that I have had for 25 years and has been abused. this one is the same size and feels heaver , more solid, than the Matco one. I have only used it once to clean up some rotors and it is fairly quite. It is not rear exhaust as some of the descriptions suggest and was the main reason I purchased this but after using it I think it should last 25 years or more.
customer_reviews.author: carmedic65

customer_reviews.title: Small but powerful
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a cheapo central pneumatic angle die grinder with this one. For the price it can't be beat. Very small but definitely power dense. Has plenty of power to run a 2" roloc wheel or carbide bur bit. I run it off of a 135 psi gas powered compressor on my service truck and it does the job. I started buying Chicago pneumatic tools after I discovered a lot of the matco tools were re-badged CP.
customer_reviews.author: John Weburg

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding tool.
customer_reviews.text: I love this tool. It is powerful, easy to use and has totally out performed my expectations. I used it with the 2 inch Roloc quick change discs to clean the machined surfaces and remove old gasket material while changing the Intake manifold gaskets on GM 5.7L engine. It did a fantastic job and made the job much easier. I wish I would have bought these years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Robert L. Kennedy Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Been using for a year and zero problems!
customer_reviews.text: Decided to stop replacing my harbor freight one every month and try this one out. Been using it every day for a year straight and not a single problem and is a lot more quiet than the harbor freight one.
customer_reviews.author: Awesomely Amazing Customer

customer_reviews.title: Yes, it’s worth it for everyday use, and the weekend warrior.
customer_reviews.text: I have this same exact one at work for about two years now, and it’s held up. So when my cheap Harbor Freight blew up, I said I’m getting this one for home, to use out in the shop. I’m a fan of most Ingersoll Rand air tools, but this one is comparable to the IR in my book.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Well made. Good power
customer_reviews.text: Way better than harbor freight, and as good as my Ingersoll rand straight grinder. Chicago pneumatic air tools are good tools. The build quality resembles that of my IR straight grinder. Good power, as long as you got a compressor that can produce the CFM's tools like this needs.
customer_reviews.author: CJM515

customer_reviews.title: 5 Years of Heavy use in Machine Tool Shop
customer_reviews.text: What else is there to say. I've been using this 90 grinder everyday for years to clean up welds, and debur parts and it still works nearly as good as when I got it. Runs super quiet without sacrificing power. Great tool.
customer_reviews.author: S. Bush

customer_reviews.title: Great die grinder
customer_reviews.text: At my job i use die grinders all day. I have had numerous brands this is by far the best! It has plenty of tourqe and never bogs down like the cheap die grinders. Am definitely buying a second one.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle K.

customer_reviews.title: Compact Yet Powerful
customer_reviews.text: This die grinder couldn't be better. I use it with 2" sanding disks and scotch brite pads to prep surfaces for welding, de-burr and soften edges, and clean rusty surfaces for paint. Despite the small size of this tool it has plenty of power for all of that. I have even run the wire knot end brush without running out of power.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product!!
customer_reviews.text: Chicago Pneumatic is a quality mid-range brand. This die grinder runs tight- low vibration and low noise. Handle is a good size. I have applied a decent side load while using a burr tool and unlike other 90 degree angle grinders, head did not come loose. I am required to do what it takes to get the job done and this tool keeps up. Only complaint is when I am using a 2 inch disk arbor to deburr parts, the head exhaust blows right at the hand- Cold on the hand.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn K

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: Great little die grinder. Very solid, good fit and lots of power. Good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Szabo

customer_reviews.title: Works good.
customer_reviews.text: Great compact die grinder. I have one at work and at home. Does produce some minor vibration but that is to be expected in this price range. If either of the two eventually fail I wouldn't hesitate to buy another.
customer_reviews.author: r.p.m.

customer_reviews.title: works good
customer_reviews.text: I've only used it a time or two so far it works good just make sure you oil it often and it should work good
customer_reviews.author: L. Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Perfect tool for the job
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful grinder at a great price. If I could only have 1 pneumatic took this would be it. It's quiet, strong, light, durable. Awesome tool
customer_reviews.author: Rphill

customer_reviews.title: Better then most in the it’s class
customer_reviews.text: Very nice. Small but packed with a punch. I’ve used the grinders on thin steel for preparation for welding. Works really well with roloc abrasives.
customer_reviews.author: Diana S.

customer_reviews.title: It is very comfortable to hold when using
customer_reviews.text: Everything was well packed and the tool is really nice looking when you open the box. After using it for the week I now find myself wanting to use it more. It the right size for my hand and it is comfortable to hold. After working all day and my hands get sore using this at the end of the day is not a bother. I will probably look at what other tools Chicago Pneumatic has and but more from them.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Licari

customer_reviews.title: It screams
customer_reviews.text: Good weight balance, needs a lot of air to operate at full capacity but other then that it’s a nice tool to have
customer_reviews.author: Brian G.

customer_reviews.title: Small and strong
customer_reviews.text: Very nicely built compact grinder. Feels solid and has some heft. Has a good amount of power to it, especially for this small size. I reach for it over my HF ones whenever I need to do something tougher like using a cut-off wheel.
customer_reviews.author: Hans S

customer_reviews.title: The Best
customer_reviews.text: This is the best one I've ever used. Small and powerful. You will never go wrong with it, it's small size, I was able to get into a drum break on a machine without removing it. Works perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Great little sander.
customer_reviews.text: For a little tool this thing is a beast for sanding.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Nikolaisen

customer_reviews.title: Little beast
customer_reviews.text: Professional grade. Good handling. I have 2 of those , it's all about maintenance. Keep it lubricated and it will last for a while.
customer_reviews.author: katayose

customer_reviews.title: Great investment
customer_reviews.text: Bought it at a good price and it has held up as good or if not better then the name brands, snap on, Marco, mac, ir
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Leverknight

customer_reviews.title: Good little grinder
customer_reviews.text: Really can't say anything bad about it. For around $50 it's a steal. Had it just for a couple of months so really can't say much about durability but knowing CP it'll be a life time. If you need a small grinder - get this one or an IR. The only down side is very slight vibration to the handle when spinning at full throttle but not a lot at all. Other then that - great tool.
customer_reviews.author: vlad

customer_reviews.title: Much quieter and smaller than the Husky grinder it replaced ...
customer_reviews.text: Much quieter and smaller than the Husky grinder it replaced. It vents exhaust to the front and is very well made. Included two different collets but I almost exclusively use the 1/4" collet for everything.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan D

customer_reviews.title: Great buy.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome little thing I love it. Use it on light and heavy duty stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Morris

customer_reviews.title: Great little die grinder
customer_reviews.text: Great die grinder, I like the smaller size I can fit it into tight spaces. I work in a tool and die shop, works good for polishing and prepping odd shaped pieces because of the size. Accidentally ran a line full of rust and still worked fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I've used the crap out of it and it seems built to last ...
customer_reviews.text: I've used the crap out of it and it seems built to last especially for such a small unit despite the fact that CP has sold out to China like almost everyone else. It has started slinging grease from the head, though my shop air pressure might have been too high at one point and blew the seal.
customer_reviews.author: GetOffMyInternet!

customer_reviews.title: Good tool for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good for the price. Had one break/stop working after 2 years of regular use and just ordered another.
customer_reviews.author: sjean

customer_reviews.title: Very nice, small, heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: As long as you dont have small children around your airtools, Tear out the trigger safety. Way more user friendly. Extremely happy with product.
customer_reviews.author: Ollie H

customer_reviews.title: 4 out of 5
customer_reviews.text: I gave a 4 out of 5 only because of the fact the air oil you put in it at first will keep out the air side but after it does that at first . It's all good just make sure to give it a run before you use it so you aren't oiling up all your parts more .
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Winner
customer_reviews.text: Smaller than expected. Pretty quiet, great price. I have had my fair share of cheap ones and expensive ones. I feel this one is just as good as $100+ ones I have had in past. So far holding up, I think I will get the same life as the $100 ones as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little grinder
customer_reviews.text: This little grinder feels great in the hand. It's compact and fits in the hand quite nicely but is suprizingly hefty for it's size. There's no shakes or rattles even at high speeds and all the threads are buttery smooth. Definitely reccomend this grinder.
customer_reviews.author: Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Good tool for the price
customer_reviews.text: Super light and works good has enough power for cleaning off old gaskets and etc...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice small but powerful grinder.
customer_reviews.text: Nice pneumatic die grinder. Small in size but powerful. It’s what I expect from Chicago Pneumatic. Great tool!
customer_reviews.author: Alfonso Ortega

customer_reviews.title: Small
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used it yet. But love the size! Smallest angle grinder I have ever owned. Update once I have a chance to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Ferreira

customer_reviews.title: Damn good tool!!!
customer_reviews.text: Damn good tool!!! If it ever break's I'm buying Another one just like it.
customer_reviews.author: S.Binion

customer_reviews.title: Damn good tool!!!
customer_reviews.text: Damn good tool!! If it ever break's I'm buying another one just like it.
customer_reviews.author: S.Binion

customer_reviews.title: wist theres a option to adjust rotation of spin. ...
customer_reviews.text: wist theres a option to adjust rotation of spin. right handed, spins in a direction where debris & spark fly right at your face
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: still enjoying the tool after a few years.
customer_reviews.text: the first one i got had missing red paint. Amazon exchanged it no problem. I has been working good and strong for a few years.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Survived 3 years of heavy duty abuse and keeps going.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a heavy duty mechanic and I've used this die grinder almost daily for 3 years in the shop. It's been used and abused since I bought it and continues take it all without a problem. Between my IR, Mac and Snap on die grinders, this one is my go-to choice every time while also being by far the cheapest.
customer_reviews.author: ANDREW

customer_reviews.title: Great power!
customer_reviews.text: Finally found a die grinder that has enough power to run a 4" cut off wheel. Very impressed!
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Awsome
customer_reviews.text: I finally use it works great in very tight places and the rpm is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: jr

customer_reviews.title: Air grinder
customer_reviews.text: This air grinder came in the mail just as advertised. So far it works great. I have only used it as a hobby type of tool. I run it off of my 60 gallon single stage compressor and it doesn't seem to take as much air as I thought it would. I have other tools that take two to three times as much air to keep up with. It's very small, palm sized, but works just the way I was expecting.
customer_reviews.author: J. Frost

customer_reviews.title: Nice finish
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used it yet but looks and feels like its quality made. Nice finish to it update once used
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Ferreira

customer_reviews.title: Chicago Pneumatic CP875
customer_reviews.text: ok here goes, this thing got great reviews is the reason i orderd it, when it arrived i thought what the heck??? this thing is smaller than my hand lol , i was thinking very seriously about sending it right back but then i thought , what do i have to lose by trying it? So glad i did, i fell in love with this lil thing lol, great tool, great price!
customer_reviews.author: Joe.K

customer_reviews.title: Reasonably quiet, not an air hog.
customer_reviews.text: I have use this often cutting steel, mostly under 1/8 inch. Good quality. I will buy another some day.
customer_reviews.author: McCain

customer_reviews.title: Vibration is an issue
customer_reviews.text: Product works great for for a die grinder. Though vibrates alot and has excessive safety features that you just don't need.
customer_reviews.author: Sean McDonough

customer_reviews.title: very worth while tool for the money
customer_reviews.text: I have gone through 2 of these but I an not complaining. They are very good quality for the money. It works very well I think I went through 1000 2 inch sand disc before I had trouble. I an border line abusing it and it held up well.
customer_reviews.author: articcolds

customer_reviews.title: I have been doing this kind of work for over 25 years and these are the best little grinders that I have used
customer_reviews.text: In 2008 I ordered a die grinder and they sent me a angle grinder. I kept it and have been using it daily for 7 years. I should add that I work in a forging plant and that grinder has been used and abused and still works. I have been doing this kind of work for over 25 years and these are the best little grinders that I have used.
customer_reviews.author: Rex R. Rudder

customer_reviews.title: Speed power compact size
customer_reviews.text: Pretty nice tool. Gets cold in the hand quickly when used in cool environment. It would be nice to have rubber or plastic grip. I love the size, and power!
customer_reviews.author: Josh Brown

customer_reviews.title: Love it, works great!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Used harbor freight ones most of shop life. Moved onto this and wished I had done it sooner. Very smooth.
customer_reviews.author: Slowjoe93

customer_reviews.title: Man this thing is strong! I've had a few ...
customer_reviews.text: Man this thing is strong! I've had a few different ones over the last few years and this one definitely spins the fastest! Just remember to oil it so it'll last a lot longer
customer_reviews.author: Jackie Chan

customer_reviews.title: Smooth and Powerful
customer_reviews.text: I use mine every day for cutting/grinding/wire wheel. It's an unbelievable value. All the power you could need and butter smooth.
customer_reviews.author: Sonny

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: You can really tell the difference in quality between these and central pneumatic
customer_reviews.author: Marvin revolorio

customer_reviews.title: They are among the best quality made
customer_reviews.text: I have used Chicago Pneumatic tools since 1982. They are among the best quality made. The tools are higher priced than some of their competition, but, cheaper when longevity is considered.
customer_reviews.author: Hendrix Head

customer_reviews.title: Good tool
customer_reviews.text: Very good tool. More torque than cheap ones. Comes with wrenches that are a step above the cheap flat ones that come with $15 grinders.
customer_reviews.author: EdV

customer_reviews.title: Great price
customer_reviews.text: As a professional automotive technician I have to say that for the price this die grinder is great. Although time will tell, way less expensive than what is offered on a tool truck.
customer_reviews.author: GypsyDanger

customer_reviews.title: Just as good as my old IR
customer_reviews.text: After my IR became unusable due to the locking nut getting stripped out after 14 years. I decided to go with a CP and have used it a few times and can say I honestly couldn't tell the difference from my higher priced IR . I feel it will last a long time .
customer_reviews.author: Lg376

customer_reviews.title: I've used 3 cutting wheels worth of use on it and works great. Defiantly suggest buying it
customer_reviews.text: I've used this thing very lightly since I purchased it. Has run flawlessly. I've used 3 cutting wheels worth of use on it and works great. Defiantly suggest buying it.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Lorensen

customer_reviews.title: For people with large hands this is going to be a bit small and awkward to handle.
customer_reviews.text: Don't let the size fool you, this little die grinder can hold its own.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: I use it all the time in the motor shop at work. Just add oil and you are good to go!
customer_reviews.author: A3FtCentipede

customer_reviews.title: works great and
customer_reviews.text: I use everyday with a 2" sanding disc , works great and fast
customer_reviews.author: hugh lafever

customer_reviews.title: Aircraft naintenance approved
customer_reviews.text: Works great for aircraft sheet metal work. Nice and small, it allows you to gwt into tight places without issue.
customer_reviews.author: nick

customer_reviews.title: This is an Excellent Buy!!
customer_reviews.text: I use this little thing to remove paint and bluing off guns. Also, I have recently used it to take off paint and rust from an old snap on tool box for restoration. This thing works great and is small enough to fit in tight areas. In addition, the safety switch is extremely useful to not turn on if you lay the tool down for a second. Most def worth my money!
customer_reviews.author: A. Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: So far been very good and high powered. Uses a ton of air but don't matter to me at my work. Think i will be using this for the next 10 years. I oil it every use.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Great CP grinder
customer_reviews.text: This is a great die grinder! All I buy for my work
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey 5366

customer_reviews.title: Wiz wheel
customer_reviews.text: This Chicago Pneumatic cut off tool is a perfect size for numerous applications in my shop. It's always useful. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Cerbone

customer_reviews.title: Great.
customer_reviews.text: Great for its size ans price. It will last near forever.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Compact, Excellent Quality
customer_reviews.text: This is the second CP tool I have recently purchased. The first was a air operated mini sawsall. Quality rating IMHO is excellent. The tool is compact, and powerful. I purchased this to clean IRS piviot points on my current project. With the Scotch Roloc pads, I was able to get a smooth clean surface. As another rater indicated I need to purchase the proper grease fitting adapter to grease the gears.
customer_reviews.author: lickahotskillet

customer_reviews.title: CHICAGO PNEUMATIC - not to be confused with CENTRAL PNEUMATIC!
customer_reviews.text: Another high quality item from Chicago Pneumatic. I've never been disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: GreenAdam

customer_reviews.title: Needs large air compress
customer_reviews.text: I did not like that it needed such a large air compressor to actually use... my 6 gallon was definitely not enough.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this grinder for one purpose and that was to grind the bolts off my exhaust manifold, which worked well. Now I use it for numerous other projects in the garage. I'm glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Romby

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This thing cranks, more power than you expect, very compact
customer_reviews.author: Mr Phil

customer_reviews.title: Powerful tool
customer_reviews.text: Has enough power for any use. Used it for small wire wheel or grinding for welds. Way better than any of brand cheap version of this tool. CP makes good stuff.
customer_reviews.author: patrick lawlor

customer_reviews.title: Die grinder
customer_reviews.text: This thing works great and has handled everything I've used it for as of yet. Quite strong compared to some others that I've used and seems to be quite well made. I would certainly recommend this to anyone for medium duty work which is all it will ever see from me. The governer is not the easiest to manipulate consistently and is the only negative I can find, but the paddle is easy to use to vary motor speed so it's not too bad. Great tool for the price!
customer_reviews.author: rbabin526

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: So far, it is proving the right tool for our project(s).
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Sterling

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: Used it a lot for two years now, no problems
customer_reviews.author: Duke

customer_reviews.title: Tiny with big quality
customer_reviews.text: It's small, like honey I shrunk the kids. Good quality, good for tight spaces.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: I have been a journeyman toolmaker for a many years and had to replace the die grinder I bought as an apprentice. This new one is a significant improvement.
customer_reviews.author: Robb Stutzer

customer_reviews.title: Gets with the Program
customer_reviews.text: Nice durable tool. Safety latch lock gets a stiff after using the tool for several hours. Otherwise, this is a good value.
customer_reviews.author: W. Barnes

customer_reviews.title: great tool
customer_reviews.text: Great tool, quality construction and materials. Solid Aluminum body and aluminum parts. Tool should last a lifetime under normal use and maintenance
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: short life
customer_reviews.text: Tool quit working within 2 mo. of limited use. Contacted C- P not much help in getting tool repaired or replaced. Said could send to one of their authorized repair locations along with proof of purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Excellent grinder performs just as it should and it's very ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent grinder performs just as it should and it's very powerful. I repair curb damage on rims and this grinder is nice and compact and more than powerful enough to grind all the curb damage down on an entire rim.
customer_reviews.author: Adesso

customer_reviews.title: Cool little tool
customer_reviews.text: I bought this too to sand down my metal deck stairs. Works great. I can't believe the power that comes out of a tool that is so small.
customer_reviews.author: Paul B

customer_reviews.title: Very good product. The tools Chicago pneumatic are the best ...
customer_reviews.text: Very good product. The tools Chicago pneumatic are the best Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Luc St-Pierre

customer_reviews.title: still works well after several months of daily use
customer_reviews.text: I am a long time full time Deburr operator at an Aerospace manufacturing company and have been using this tool as well as the CP straight motor version of this too and I use these two tools very aggressively on very hard metals for several hours a day now for several months for 4 days a week. I put the oil in it at the beginning of every work day and do my job and it still works as good today as it did several months ago. It also has alot of speed and torque which is what I need when I'm blending metal surfaces of titanium, 15-5 stainless. and inconel
customer_reviews.author: S. MCCANN

customer_reviews.title: Red Delicious Die-Grinder
customer_reviews.text: Gotta say, I was a little skeptical about a product from Chicago. However, I am more than pleasantly surprised at the build quality, speed and looks. Very nice Die-Grinder to be sure. I originally picked this because it's red and since I work in a motorcycle shop, can be easily located. Once I used this thing the only way I could describe it is the fit and finish are very good and I would buy Chicago tools again for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Motorcycle Paul

customer_reviews.title: Good grinder
customer_reviews.text: This is your standard angle die grinder. Well built but loud. This is replacing one that has seen daily use for better than 10 years.
customer_reviews.author: canoer79

customer_reviews.title: This is a great little grinder
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little grinder! I bought one six months ago, and I liked it so much I bought another.
customer_reviews.author: Mike C

customer_reviews.title: chicago cp875 air die grinder
customer_reviews.text: Price and quality seems to be at least on a par with others. It uses a considerable amount of air to operate it continuously, as others I have owned.
customer_reviews.author: jetguy702

customer_reviews.title: ... why they painted it red but whatever still works great with 2" Roloc pads
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why they painted it red but whatever still works great with 2" Roloc pads.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Has front air discharge didn't realize when purchased prefer rear air discharge but beats the crap out of H
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. Has front air discharge didn't realize when purchased prefer rear air discharge but beats the crap out of H.F.Tools and H.Depot air tools. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Looner

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Grinder
customer_reviews.text: Cannot go wrong with "Chicago Pnuematic" Tools I have used them for years! They last and the quality is obviuos!

customer_reviews.title: Works fine
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to work on an exhaust manifold and it got the job done lickity split. Easy to control with it's small size.

product_meta.title: #CP875-22;500 RPM - 1/4'' Collet - Pneumatic Right Angle Pistol Grip Die Grinder
product_meta.description:
The product type is #CP875 - 22; 500 RPM - 1/4'' Collet - Pneumatic Right Angle Pistol Grip Die Grinder. This product is made in United States and it is manufactured by Chicago Pneumatic.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The CP875 is an economical 1/4-Inch Mini Angle Air Die Grinder. This extremely popular tool is compact and has a lightweight design for easy maneuverability. Lock off throttle prevents accidental start ups. 90 degree angle head allows flexibility in tight quarters. . Applications - high speed blending, smoothing, porting and deburring in confined areas. Specifications: collet: 1/4-Inch and 6mm, cfm - 4, hose size - 3/8-Inch, free speed - 21,000.
